title: Blob
data:
The **blob** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [b](/wiki/B "B") glyph (b). Blobs are designated internally by the macro **S\_BLOB**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- b [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob")
- b [quivering blob](/wiki/Quivering_blob "Quivering blob")
- b [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [5 References](#References)

## Common traits

Blobs are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [amoeboids](/wiki/Amoeboid "Amoeboid") that are [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") and lack several [body parts](/wiki/Body_parts "Body parts"): they have no limbs, eyes or heads. Each blob is generally slower-moving than an unhasted and unburdened [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero"), and they have a tendency to wander around while moving. Blobs have [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

### Generation

Randomly generated blobs are always created hostile except for the acid blob, which may generate as peaceful towards neutral characters.

## History

The blob monster class first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") - the acid blob, quivering blob and gelatinous cube all appear in previous versions of *NetHack*, and NetHack 3.0.0 establishes the monster class and its current glyph to group them under.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces a few new monsters to the monster class:

- b [jiggling blob](/wiki/Jiggling_blob "Jiggling blob")
- b [lava blob](/wiki/Lava_blob "Lava blob")
- b [static blob](/wiki/Static_blob "Static blob")
- b [burbling blob](/wiki/Burbling_blob "Burbling blob")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

- b [blob of preserved organs](/wiki/Blob_of_preserved_organs "Blob of preserved organs")
- b [crystal ooze](/wiki/Crystal_ooze "Crystal ooze")
- b [blood bloater](/wiki/Blood_bloater "Blood bloater")
- b [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(dNetHack\) "Shoggoth (dNetHack)")
- b [priest of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priest_of_Ghaunadaur "Priest of Ghaunadaur")
- b [mothering mass](/wiki/Mothering_mass "Mothering mass")
- b [coiling brawn](/index.php?title=Coiling_brawn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Coiling brawn (page does not exist)")
- b [deep blue cube](/index.php?title=Deep_blue_cube\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deep blue cube (page does not exist)")
- b [pitch black cube](/index.php?title=Pitch_black_cube\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pitch black cube (page does not exist)")
- b [perfectly clear cube](/index.php?title=Perfectly_clear_cube\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Perfectly clear cube (page does not exist)")

## Encyclopedia entry

These giant amoeboid creatures look like nothing more than puddles of slime, but they both live and move, feeding on metal or wood as well as the occasional dungeon explorer to supplement their diet.  
  
But we were not on a station platform. We were on the track ahead as the nightmare, plastic column of fetid black iridescence oozed tightly onward through its fifteen-foot sinus, gathering unholy speed and driving before it a spiral, re-thickening cloud of the pallid abyss vapor. It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and unforming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter.

\[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 16](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L16)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 145](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L145)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Blob

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The blob is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase b glyph (b). Blobs are designated internally by the macro S_BLOB.[1]

The class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • b acid blob
  • b quivering blob
  • b gelatinous cube

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 dNetHack
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Common traits

Blobs are neutral amoeboids that are unbreathing and lack several body parts: they have no limbs, eyes or heads. Each blob is generally slower-moving than an unhasted and unburdened hero, and they have a tendency to wander around while moving. Blobs have sleep resistance and poison resistance.

Generation

Randomly generated blobs are always created hostile except for the acid blob, which may generate as peaceful towards neutral characters.

History

The blob monster class first appears in NetHack 3.0.0 - the acid blob, quivering blob and gelatinous cube all appear in previous versions of NetHack, and NetHack 3.0.0 establishes the monster class and its current glyph to group them under.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces a few new monsters to the monster class:

  • b jiggling blob
  • b lava blob
  • b static blob
  • b burbling blob

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

  • b blob of preserved organs
  • b crystal ooze
  • b blood bloater
  • b shoggoth
  • b priest of Ghaunadaur
  • b mothering mass
  • b coiling brawn
  • b deep blue cube
  • b pitch black cube
  • b perfectly clear cube

Encyclopedia entry

These giant amoeboid creatures look like nothing more than puddles of slime, but they both live and move, feeding on metal or wood as well as the occasional dungeon explorer to supplement their diet.

But we were not on a station platform. We were on the track ahead as the nightmare, plastic column of fetid black iridescence oozed tightly onward through its fifteen-foot sinus, gathering unholy speed and driving before it a spiral, re-thickening cloud of the pallid abyss vapor. It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and unforming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter.

[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 16
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 145
